conversations.content: The Fledgling Circus: Part One
Once upon a time, a fledgling dragon befriended a young boy.
The two loved fun above all else, and each morning, they greeted each other in the exact same way: ＂Ready for some tomfoolery?＂
They played tag, they played hide- and-seek, they wrought mischief on adults unlike any prank history had seen. There was seemingly no end to their creativity.
One day, a bright and colorful tent was erected in the boy's village. It was their first encounter ever with a circus.
Clearly this was tomfoolery on a whole new level!
They couldn't get enough of the spectacle. There was the flying trapeze, the knife throwing, and even the fearsome beast tamers.
Oh, and let us not forget the clownfoolery (as they soon took to calling it). Yes, the boy and his dragon were instantly in love.
＂The big top is tops!＂ cried the boy. ＂We should join up!＂ said the dragon.
And thus was a small—but special— dragon-taming duo born.
The two started by regaling the village with feats they had devised. Though it wasn't fancy, both boy and dragon knew they had a bona fide circus show on their hands.
Tomfoolery was had in spades... but like all shows, theirs eventually had to come to an end.
It was a simple, inexorable fact, but they were too young to know or expect it...
The Fledgling Circus: Part Two
Enamored with the big top, the boy-and-dragon duo had taken to regaling the village with their own unique circus show.
Spring sprung, summer sweltered, fall fell, and then came the chill of winter—but they continued their act tirelessly no matter the season.
So when the first rejection came, it was like the snap of someone's fingers ruining a perfect daydream.
＂Ready for some tomfoolery?＂ asked the dragon one glorious day. ＂I can't,＂ replied the boy. ＂I have to help around the house.＂
＂Ready for some tomfoolery?＂ ＂I can't. I have to watch my children.＂
＂Ready for some tomfoolery?＂ ＂I can't. I just...can't. These old bones can't handle such antics anymore.＂
All boys must grow up. All dragons too, of course, but the boy aged more quickly—from the dragon's perspective, cruelly so.
What had happened to his spry partner in crime? He became too big, too busy, and too broken to perform. And then, just like that...he was gone.
The dragon tried to forget his sadness by forgetting his greatest source of joy—the circus.
But such things are not so easily forgotten.
＂I'm ready for some tomfoolery,＂ he thought.
His heart begged for those days to return, for just one more chance to bring a smile to someone's face.
But the seasons crept by, each more monotonous and lonely than the last.
The dragon was ready to give up, for he felt he would never have a fun day again. But then...
＂Why so glum, little drake?＂ said a small voice. ＂Come with me! We'll go see the circus!＂
It had been untold years since the dragon had heard that word. But he went to see, and lo and behold, there it was: the bright and colorful tent that had once made his heart sing.
His eyes sparkled as he let out a roar of joy.
Some time later, a spectacular circus troupe became the talk of a certain harbor town. And the stars were a young girl...and her dragon.
On this very day, they'll be regaling the town with tomfoolery on an unprecedented scale.
Don't believe it? Then step right through the pleats of that big tent over there and see for yourself. You can't miss it.
Hurry, now. They'll be raising the curtain any moment...
